Regarding Twitter‚Äôs reduction in force, unfortunately there is no choice when the company is losing over $4M/day.

Everyone exited was offered 3 months of severance, which is 50% more than legally required.

Again, to be crystal clear, Twitter‚Äôs strong commitment to content moderation remains absolutely unchanged.

content: Tesla Solar + Powerwall battery enables consumers to be their own utility

author: elonmusk
content:
Powerwall 2 peak & steady power capability is better than advertised. 

Now that we have lots of operational data, Tesla can unlock higher capabilities for free via software update next month. 

Depending on production date, power increase power may be >50% at 30C ambient temp.

author: elonmusk
content: Solar power will feed exclusively to Powerwall. Powerwall will interface only between utility meter & house main breaker panel, enabling super simple install & seamless whole house backup during utility dropouts.

author: elonmusk
content: Starting next week, Tesla Solar Panels & Solar Roof will only be sold as an integrated product *with* Tesla Powerwall battery

author: elonmusk
content: The extreme difficulty of scaling production of new technology is not well understood. It‚Äôs 1000% to 10,000% harder than making a few prototypes. The machine that makes the machine is vastly harder than the machine itself.

author: elonmusk
content: We intend to increase, not reduce battery cell purchases from Panasonic, LG & CATL (possibly other partners too). However, even with our cell suppliers going at maximum speed, we still foresee significant shortages in 2022 & beyond unless we also take action ourselves.

author: elonmusk
content: Important note about Tesla Battery Day unveil tomorrow. This affects long-term production, especially Semi, Cybertruck & Roadster, but what we announce will not reach serious high-volume production until 2022.

content: A prior track record of exceptional achievement in engineering *is* required, but *no* prior experience working on the brain or human physiology is required. We will teach you what‚Äôs known about the brain, which is not much tbh.

author: elonmusk
content: Our NN is initially in Python for rapid iteration, then converted to C++/C/raw metal driver code for speed (important!). Also, tons of C++/C engineers needed for vehicle control & entire rest of car. Educational background is irrelevant, but all must pass hardcore coding test.

author: elonmusk
content: Tesla will hold a super fun AI party/hackathon at my house with the Tesla AI/autopilot team in about four weeks. Invitations going out soon.

author: elonmusk
content: We are (obviously) also looking for world-class chip designers to join our team, based in both Palo Alto & Austin

author: elonmusk
content: Dojo, our training supercomputer, will be able to process vast amounts of video training data & efficiently run hypersparce arrays with a vast number of parameters, plenty of memory & ultra-high bandwidth between cores. More on this later.

author: elonmusk
content: Our custom 144 TOPS in-vehicle inference computer, where almost every TOP is useable & optimized for NN, far exceeds anything else in volume production, giving you the hardware you need to run sophisticated nets

author: elonmusk
content: Tesla will soon have over a million connected vehicles worldwide with sensors & compute needed for full self-driving, which is orders of magnitude more than everyone else combined, giving you the best possible dataset to work with

author: elonmusk
content: When you read double standard articles about Tesla, please ask why. Maybe there‚Äôs a good reason that isn‚Äôt obvious.

author: elonmusk
content: Reality is a Tesla, like most electric cars, is over 500% *less* likely to catch fire than combustion engine cars, which carry massive amounts of highly flammable fuel. Why is this never mentioned?

author: elonmusk
content: Over a million combustion engine (it‚Äôs right there in the name!) car fires per year & thousands of deaths, but one Tesla car fire with no injuries gets biggest headlines. Why the double standard? This is a real question.

author: elonmusk
content: Those who predicted Tesla & EVs would be dead & autonomy would never happen are same people attacking Tesla today for 6-12 month delays, while ignoring major automakers 5+ years late. Why the double standard?

author: elonmusk
content: Almost all coverage back then said hydrogen fuel cells would destroy electric cars & autonomy was between 10 years & never ‚Ä¶

author: elonmusk
content: Zip2 also built a newspaper publishing platform that brought hundreds of regional & city papers online for the first time, and made major functionality advancements to the NY Times, Boston Globe & Knight-Ridder websites. NYT, KR & Hearst were all major investors in Zip2.

author: elonmusk
content: At Zip2, I wrote entire V1 of software for drawing vector maps & calculating point to point directions anywhere in US (first ever company to do so), as well as white pages & business listings w reviews (an early Yelp). Also wrote V1 of classifieds, autotrading & real estate apps.

author: elonmusk
content: More background: I arrived in North America at 17 w $2000, a backpack & a suitcase full of books. Paid my own way thru college. Dropped out of Stanford Eng/Phys grad school w $110k in college debt. Created Internet startup w bro & Greg Khouri (love bro & loved Greg, may he RIP)

author: elonmusk
content: 19 years ago, when my 1st company got bought, I had to decide between buying a house in Palo Alto or a McLaren F1 (best car ever imo). Was no contest. I bought F1 & a small condo that was much cheaper than the car. New Tesla Roadster will exceed all gas sports cars in every way‚Ä¶

author: elonmusk
content: SpaceX option package for new Tesla Roadster will include ~10 small rocket thrusters arranged seamlessly around car. These rocket engines dramatically improve acceleration, top speed, braking & cornering. Maybe they will even allow a Tesla to fly ‚Ä¶

author: elonmusk
content: Tesla dual motor means there is a motor in front & a motor in rear. One is optimized for power & one for range. Car drives fine even if a motor breaks down. Helps ensure you make it to your destination & don‚Äôt get stuck on side of road in potentially unsafe conditions.

author: elonmusk
content: Cost of normal dual motor AWD option is $5k. Range is also 310 miles. Takes 0-60mph to 4.5 sec & top speed to 140 mph.

author: elonmusk
content: Tesla AWD is dual motor, so you can fully drive the car even if one breaks

author: elonmusk
content: Cost of all options, wheels, paint, etc  is included (apart from Autopilot). Cost is $78k. About same as BMW M3, but 15% quicker & with better handling. Will beat anything in its class on the track.

Tesla Goes Bankrupt
Palo Alto, California, April 1, 2018 -- Despite intense efforts to raise money, including a last-ditch mass sale of Easter Eggs, we are sad to report that Tesla has gone completely and totally bankrupt. So bankrupt, you can't believe it.

content: Want to clarify that as individuals, the people responsible for the high costs & long timelines are almost all well-meaning, but the system of incentives is messed up

author: elonmusk
content: Falcon lands on droneship, but the lockout collet doesn't latch on one the four legs, causing it‚Ä¶ https://t.co/DpXsRQWal9

author: elonmusk
content: If speed at stage separation > ~6000 km/hr. With a ship, no need to zero out lateral velocity, so can stage at up to ~9000 km/h.

author: elonmusk
content: As mentioned before, ship landings are needed for high velocity missions. Altitude & distance don't mean much for orbit. All about speed.

author: elonmusk
content: Well, at least the pieces were bigger this time! Won't be last RUD, but am optimistic about upcoming ship landing. https://t.co/w007TccANJ

author: elonmusk
content: However, that was not what prevented it being good. Touchdown speed was ok, but a leg lockout didn't latch, so it tipped over after landing.

author: elonmusk
content: Definitely harder to land on a ship. Similar to an aircraft carrier vs land: much smaller target area, that's also translating & rotating.

author: elonmusk
content: Maybe some debris ingestion. Engine data looks ok. Will borescope tonight. This is one of the outer engines.

author: elonmusk
content: Conducted hold-down firing of returned Falcon rocket. Data looks good overall, but engine 9 showed thrust fluctuations.

content: Reasons I like tunnels: you still travel in 3D fast, but immune to weather, quiet and no risk cars fall on your head

content: Flying car pros: travel in 3D fast. Cons: risk of car falling on head much greater, noisy, grounded in bad weather

content: Contrary to press reports, I'm not against flying cars. Just said it was important to consider both pros and cons.

author: elonmusk
content: The gas generator is a small rocket engine that powers the turbopump, which produces 7000 horsepower & weighs 160 lbs

author: elonmusk
content: Engines are cycling cleanly w ground pneumatics. Replaced gas generator on engine 9 (center) as a precautionary measure.

author: elonmusk
content: Abort was caused by oxygen in ground side TEA-TEB. Upper stage on separate internal circuit, so doesn't face same risk.

author: elonmusk
content: Rocket engines are healthy, but cleaning turbopump gas generators will take another day. Aiming for Mon eve launch.

author: elonmusk
content: We called manual abort. Better to be paranoid and wrong. Bringing rocket down to borescope engines ...

author: elonmusk
content: If launch aborts, we will bring the rocket down for engine inspection, so probably a few days before next attempt

author: elonmusk
content: Increasing helium spin start pressure. Probably <50% chance of passing all aborts, but worth a try. Countdown resuming ...

content: Launch aborted by autosequence due to slower than expected thrust ramp. Seems ok on closer inspection. Cycling countdown.

content: Yeah, climate change should really be considered a centrist issue, as it affects everyone.

author: elonmusk
content: Am not suggesting shutting down CO2 production, but rather to price in environmental cost & shift to sustainable energy

author: elonmusk
content: Even if the answer is only on the order of 1%, we should still take immediate action, as there is only one atmosphere.

author: elonmusk
content: Right question to ask Dyson or others: what is probability that human actions could cause catastrophic climate change?

author: elonmusk
content: What most serious scientists have a problem with is the notion of certainty about *any* subject. That is not the point.

author: elonmusk
content: Sorry for all the heavy stuff abt climate change, but I really thought world wd take action sooner. No time for subtlety

author: elonmusk
content: In reality, 97% of scientists agree that we face serious human generated climate change http://t.co/soQCnJB61B

author: elonmusk
content: Climate change deniers claim "scientists disagree", same rebuttal used by tobacco industry about lung cancer for decades

author: elonmusk
content: Technically, I "got rich" from Zip2 & PayPal w zero govt anything, then put 100% of that into SpaceX, Tesla & SolarCity.

author: elonmusk
content: If consumption is low, then the tax is proportionately low. We should prob not have tax on basic foods & critical meds.

author: elonmusk
content: Net of gas savings, a Tesla is $550 to $600/month with down payment taken care of by tax credits. Maybe less costly then it first seems.

author: elonmusk
content: Yes, am arguing against subsidies and in favor of a tax on the end bad created. Market will then achieve best solution.

author: elonmusk
content: Trees are net consumers of CO2, so technically we would pay them money :)

author: elonmusk
content: Exactly. Seems crazy to risk the CO2 chemical experiment when we have to find another solution anyway.

author: elonmusk
content: Big difference between taxing people and taxing purchases (ie consumption). Much better to emphasize the latter.

author: elonmusk
content: Me & other private money funded Tesla for first 7 years, got IPO+ govt money for 3, now paid back. Yes, carbon tax would be a better way.

author: elonmusk
content: Weight of scientific evidence. Taxes don't ban a purchase, they just increase cost. Am against bans, except in extreme cases.

author: elonmusk
content: Exactly. Better to tax known bad thing and incent desired outcome, instead of subsidizing particular solution paths. Let market decide.

author: elonmusk
content: Perhaps. I am in favor of fair, simple taxes that are neutral on most things, incent good & disincent bad.
